meta.title: Introduction to Financial Accounting
meta.description: Discover the fundamentals of financial accounting from the ground up. This course will teach you to prepare and analyze financial statements. You will also learn to use your understanding of accounting to drive insights into business performance.

learning-objectives: Describe the nature of business and the role of accounting in business/Articulate basic business concepts
Describe the nature of business and the role of accounting in business/Define commonly used business accounts and classify each into one of five account types
Present the accounting equation and define each component of the equation/Express the five account types in a mathematical equation
Present the accounting equation and define each component of the equation/Describe and illustrate how net income impacts retained earnings
Present the accounting equation and define each component of the equation/Classify accounts as either temporary or permanent based on the category each falls into
Describe and illustrate how business transactions are classified and recorded and how they impact the components of the accounting equation/Express transactions in the double-entry accounting format

Describe and illustrate how business transactions are classified and recorded and how they impact the components of the accounting equation/Determine accounts affected and the nature of the impact for common business events

Describe and illustrate how business transactions are classified and recorded and how they impact the components of the accounting equation/Illustrate accounts affected and the nature of the impact for common business events in a tabular format
Describe and illustrate how business transactions are classified and recorded and how they impact the components of the accounting equation/Express transactions in the double-entry accounting format

Describe and illustrate how business transactions are classified and recorded and how they impact the components of the accounting equation/Determine accounts affected and the nature of the impact for common business events

Describe and illustrate how business transactions are classified and recorded and how they impact the components of the accounting equation/Illustrate accounts affected and the nature of the impact for common business events in a tabular format
